title: Playing Video in Firefox messes up my HDMI connection
content:
Using Windows 10, an Nvidia GTX 1080, and a Panasonic VSX-40 receiver, connected by HDMI.

I recently got a new stereo receiver and have been seeing problems with the HDMI connection. The the image becomes discolored and green at times and stays that way until the receiver is restarted or the input is switched off HDMI and back.

After extensive troubleshooting (replacing cables, updating drivers, testing to reproduce the problem) I have determined that Firefox is the issue.

Playing a youtube video or a twitch stream has a small chance of causing the error. Mousing over a tab with a video in it causes the error almost 100% of the time. The same videos and streams do not cause these problems in Google Chrome.

I have disabled hardware acceleration in Firefox settings and that has solved the issue, but now I have the problem that Firefox is not using hardware acceleration. It scrolls poorly and generally sucks to use this way.

Is there a way to change the way Firefox displays these videos without disabling hardware acceleration completely? Chrome renders them without causing issues, and I've been unable to trigger this error in any way outside of Firefox.

title: Mancato ripristino schede chiuse di recente
content:
Ciao a tutti e grazie per la disponibilità. Normalmente mantengo molte pagine aperte su Mozilla, anche 700-800. Ovviamente Mozilla ogni volta me le roapre tutte, tranne in alcuni casi, per una chiusura improvvisa o per un mio errore di chiusura. In questi casi Mozilla alla riapertura mi propone una sola pagina, ma andando su: "Cronologia-Schede chiuse di recente-Riapri tutte le schede" mi riapre tutte le schede della sessione precedente. Oggi ho lanciato Mozilla e si è bloccato evidenziando "Non risponde", ho aspettato del tempo e, visto che era bloccato in quella situazione, ho chiuso con la X e poi con "chiudi il programma. Ho riaperto Mozilla e le 2 voci in cronologia "schede chiuse di recente" e "finestre chiuse di recente" sono grigie. Sono disperato e vorrei chiedervi se qualcuno di voi può aiutarmi per recuperare le moltissime schede della sessione precedente. Approfitto della vostra gentilezza per chiedervi anche se conoscete un modo per salvare le schede attuali aperte, magari su un file in modo da poterle recuperare comunque. Vi ringrazio in anticipo.

Aldo Pistilli
creator: aldo.pistilli

title: Setting "Open PDF in external PDF Viewer" always fail after restarting Firefox
content:
Hello all.

I chose "Use Adobe Acrobat Reader" for open PDF in settings and it works fine until I closed Firefox and open it again. The setting bounce to "Open in Firefox". Then, I tried choosing "Always Ask", closing Firefox and opening Firefox again. The setting preserved as "Always Ask" and did not bounce to "Open in Firefox".

I checked handler.json in user profile folder after I chose "Use Adobe Acrobat Reader" for PDF, action is 4: {"defaultHandlersVersion":{},"mimeTypes":{"application/pdf":{"action":4,"extensions":["pdf"],"handlers":[{"name":"AcroRd32.exe","path":"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Adobe\\Acrobat Reader DC\\Reader\\AcroRd32.exe"}]}},"schemes":{}}

But then after restarting Firefox, it changed to 3: {"defaultHandlersVersion":{},"mimeTypes":{"application/pdf":{"action":3,"extensions":["pdf"],"handlers":[{"name":"AcroRd32.exe","path":"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Adobe\\Acrobat Reader DC\\Reader\\AcroRd32.exe"}]}},"schemes":{}}

Checked handler.json with "Always ask". Before and after restarting Firefox, action is 1, which is expected and correct.

Some other colleagues reported the same issues as well. I am thinking if this is a bug from Firefox.

Some more notes here:

  • The issue only happens to PDF, for other Content types, all good.
  • Already disabled all plug-ins and extensions.
  • Tried refreshing Firefox in safe mode
  • Tried choosing another external PDF reader Foxit
  • Firefox version is 140.0.2

Some screenshots are attached showing where it is.

Hope someone can help on it. Thanks in advance.
creator: racsonleungha

title: How to backup OneDrive for Business to a local drive?
content: Backing up OneDrive for Business to a local drive isn’t a native feature in Microsoft, but there are a few ways to do it. If you have multiple user accounts or need scheduled backups, using a third-party tool is the way to go. I’ve used Migrate Cloud Data’s OneDrive Backup Tool, which allows you to download OneDrive data locally in a structured format.
creator: WilliamsWelsh

title: How to backup OneDrive for Business to a local drive?
content: Backing up OneDrive for Business to a local drive isn’t a native feature in Microsoft, but there are a few ways to do it. If you have multiple user accounts or need scheduled backups, using a third-party tool is the way to go. I’ve used Migrate Cloud Data’s OneDrive Backup Tool, which allows you to download OneDrive data locally in a structured format. Here’s how it works: You log in with your OneDrive credentials. Select the folders or items you want to back up. Choose your local destination folder (on your computer or external drive). You can also apply filters (like date range or file type) to download only specific data. The tool keeps the original folder structure and metadata (like created date, modified date, etc.). This is useful if you’re looking for a local backup for disaster recovery, compliance or offline access.
creator: WilliamsWelsh

title: How to backup OneDrive for Business to a local drive?
content: Backing up OneDrive for Business to a local drive isn’t a native feature in Microsoft, but there are a few ways to do it. If you have multiple user accounts or need scheduled backups, using a third-party tool is the way to go. I’ve used Migrate Cloud Data’s OneDrive Backup Tool, which allows you to download OneDrive data locally in a structured format. Here’s how it works: You log in with your OneDrive credentials. Select the folders or items you want to back up. Choose your local destination folder (on your computer or external drive). You can also apply filters (like date range or file type) to download only specific data. The tool keeps the original folder structure and metadata (like created date, modified date, etc.). This is useful if you’re looking for a local backup for disaster recovery, compliance or offline access.
creator: WilliamsWelsh

title: 403 Forbidden
content:
From a week ago, for no apparent reason, I get "403 Forbidden" when I try to read articles on seattletimes.com using my prescription to the site. It's a total block of the site.

After rebooting, the site is OK until I log in, as needed to read particular articles. Then nothing is accessible any more.

The trouble is the same on all my laptop/desktop computors, which all have Firefox and are in sync with it, and once I log into the site on one of them it's blocked on all. But this doesn't affect my android phone, on which every article can still be read. 

This is clearlly therefore a Firefox problem.  I'm worried that I'll have to switch out of Firefox to some other browser.  This is unreliable behavior.

RTR

title: myNoise website has stopped working since latest update
content:
Hello support-type people,

I have a specific website that I have active in FireFox called myNoise.net. It allows me to generate background noise generators to cover-up the distracting noises from my neighbours when working at home on my desktop computer. The audio on the website worked the last time I opened Firefox ~2 July ... but today, when I opened the browser, the audio no longer works. I cannot get the website audio to load at all - I added the website to additional exception lists & shut down some content blocking extensions, but no joy. The website was already listed in multiple exception lists & I do not know or understand what change(s) occurred with the browser that would prevent this site from properly functioning - since it literally worked a week ago. I would appreciate any assistance and/or guidance with this issue, otherwise I will be eliminating Firefox as one of my browser options. I have provided a screenshot of the site that shows the perpetual "now loading" screen. Thank you.
creator: diana.l.simpson

title: The Firefox update ate my bookmarks!  HELP!
content:
I don't think I chose the right topic, but here goes. With every Firefox update, my bookmarks and everything always seemed to merge into the new update. My computer rebooted with updates today, and I get into Firefox to find that NONE of my bookmarks made it this time.

Everything is empty, and I don't have a backup anywhere because I didn't expect this. Yes, I know - always back up everything but honestly, I haven't had time.

Does anyone know how to fix this? Are my bookmarks hidden somewhere?

I have a lot of stuff for research for writing stored in my bookmarks, and I can't lose them.

Thank you for your help!

title: Doesn't load pages of a commercial site correctly
content:
Equipment: Mac using Ventura 13.7.5 Website: www.jewelosco.com (supermarket in Chicago area)

Main page loads fine but when a category is selected and then a SUB CATEGORY is selected, it shows the page as it should but says "0" items available.

Firefox worked flawlessly for years with the website until several weeks ago when this problem began. I spoke to the Jewel foods help center and they said it was a browser issue. This was proven correct when, at their suggestion, I try using Safari. I did and the website functioned correctly.

I have been a very loyal Firefox user for over 15 years. I hate to think this problem would force me to migrate to Safari. Please help !

Ed K edkarleski@gmail com (missing "i" intentional)
